description: This course takes a deep dive into mail merge within Word 2016.  Mail merge is a powerful function to batch process personalized letters or emails as well as create mailing labels and envelopes. The hosts take extra time to explain the different types of data sources that can be used, how to create letters and emails, how to add images to envelopes and labels, and apply rules to extend the capabilities of the mail merge process.
descriptionMD: This course takes a deep dive into mail merge within Word 2016.  Mail merge is a powerful function to batch process personalized letters or emails as well as create mailing labels and envelopes. The hosts take extra time to explain the different types of data sources that can be used, how to create letters and emails, how to add images to envelopes and labels, and apply rules to extend the capabilities of the mail merge process.
name: Word 2016 Mail Merge
subtitle: Comprehensive series on mail merge in Word

episodes.description: This course takes a deep dive into mail merge within Word 2016.  Mail merge is a powerful function to batch process personalized letters or emails as well as create mailing labels and envelopes. The hosts take extra time to explain the different types of data sources that can be used, how to create letters and emails, how to add images to envelopes and labels, and apply rules to extend the capabilities of the mail merge process.
episodes.title: Overview

episodes.description: Daniel and Vonne introduce mail merge in Word 2016. They review the overall steps needed to produce personalized letters, labels, envelopes, and emails.
episodes.title: Introduction to Mail Merge

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Daniel take a closer look at data sources, specifically using an existing list.  They explain and show different files types that can be used for a mailing list (data source) such as .xlsx, .csv, .txt,  and even .docx with a table.  They also cover connecting to different types of databases such as Access, SQL, and Oracle.
episodes.title: Data Sources: Existing List

episodes.description: Things don't always go as plan. In this episode, Daniel and Vonne discuss how to troubleshoot data source connections. They cover encoding issues with .csv files and .txt files, including work arounds to fix those files. They also show the issues with using a Word table file with extra content besides a table.
episodes.title: Data Sources: Troubleshooting

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel continue with troubleshooting data source connections in mail merge. In this episode, they discuss how extra spaces in cell content and cell formatting in Excel can affect your mail merge results. They also show how your data source file will be locked for editing while the Word document with a connection to that source is open. Finally, they show warnings associated with missing source data files as well as missing or mismatched fields when switching a data source to a different file.
episodes.title: Data Sources: Troubleshooting Part 2

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel focus on using Outlook contacts as a data source for mail merge. They explain organizing contacts into folders in Outlook and what folders will be available as an option in a mail merge. They also discuss how to perform a mail merge from Outlook.
episodes.title: Data Sources: Mail Contacts

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate how to create an impromptu mailing list as a data source. They show how to remove premade fields and add custom fields in the New Address List dialog box and add records. They also explain more about the .mdb file format created.
episodes.title: Data Sources: New List

episodes.description: Daniel and Vonne dive into composing a letter with merged fields. They review and combine the information presented in the introduction and data source episodes, show how to insert fields, preview results, and merge and finish into a final document.
episodes.title: Letters

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel show how to create mailing labels with a mail merge. They examine the different types of label layouts, the importance of the update label button, and tips and tricks on formatting labels.
episodes.title: Labels: Mail Merge

episodes.description: Daniel and Vonne continue with labels, specifically demonstrating how to produce and print a single label or a full page of the same label.  They cover tips on avoiding extra paragraphs and formatting the  table and columns for proper text alignment.
episodes.title: Labels: Single and Full Page

episodes.description: In this episode, Daniel and Vonne demonstrate how to add images to labels to both mail merge labels and full page of same labels. Vonne gives lots of tips and tricks, from personal experience, to align images in labels without having to pull your hair out in frustration.
episodes.title: Labels: Add Image

episodes.description: Daniel and Vonne explore how to create envelopes both individually and with a mail merge. They cover filling out the return and delivery address in the envelopes dialog box, format addresses, and the overall layout of the resulting envelope.  They also show how to insert an envelope into the current document and review some tips for creating envelopes to post office standards.
episodes.title: Envelopes

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel continue with envelopes, specifically covering how to add an image to an envelope for  a single envelope or mail merge.
episodes.title: Envelopes: Add Image

episodes.description: In this episode, Vonne and Daniel show how to use mail merge to send personalized bulk email messages. They discuss the importance having the recipient's email addresses in the data source and review the different ways to send the merged email - plain text, HTML, or as attachment.
episodes.title: Email

episodes.description: Being able to control what records to use in a mail merge is important. In this episode, Vonne and Daniel show how to use filter and sort on merged records. They also show how to find a specific record as well as duplicate records in a mail merge.
episodes.title: Filter, Sort, Find

episodes.description: Daniel and Vonne introduce and review the different mail merge rules in Word.  In this episode, Vonne demonstrates the merge record number, merge sequence number, skip record if, and next record if rules.
episodes.title: Rules

episodes.description: Daniel and Vonne continue to demonstrate rules for mail merge.  In this episode, they specifically cover the if then else rule and how it can be used to write conditional statements to further extend the personalization of mail merge messages.
episodes.title: Rules: If Then Else

episodes.description: Vonne and Daniel finish up rules in mail merge by demonstrating the ask and fill-in rules. They demonstrate certain nuances and best practices for pertinent use  of the rules.
episodes.title: Rules: Ask and Fill-in
